SEARCH
Package it.polimi.ingsw.server.controller

Interface PlayerObservableTracker

All Known Implementing Classes:
BaseServerConnection
public interface PlayerObservableTracker
Allows to track observables registered by a player in order to automatically unregister them once said player disconnects
See Also:
  • Provider.registerObserver(Consumer)
  • Provider.unregisterObserver(Consumer)

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes
    Modifier and Type
    Interface
    Description
    static interface 
    PlayerObservableTracker.ThrowingConsumer<T>
    Consumer which is allowed to throw disconnection related user exceptions, pushing the burden of handling them on someone else

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    <T> Consumer<T>
    registerObserver(Provider<T> toObserve, PlayerObservableTracker.ThrowingConsumer<T> observer)
    Register an observable for the given player and track it in order to remove it on disconnection

  • Method Details

    • registerObserver

      <T> Consumer<T> registerObserver(Provider<T> toObserve, PlayerObservableTracker.ThrowingConsumer<T> observer)
      Register an observable for the given player and track it in order to remove it on disconnection

      In addition, the observer will be wrapped to catch any potential disconnection exceptions and act based on those to close the connection and signal the player as disconnected

      Type Parameters:
      T - type of the observable value
      Parameters:
      toObserve - value the current player is interested in observing
      observer - player's observable
      Returns:
      the actual observer registered to the value, which is an implementation that wraps the given toObserve parameter
